title: Nvidia Is on Pace to Surpass Amazon's Market Cap
text: LIVE COVERAGE | CONCLUDED Last Updated: Feb. 13, 2024 at 8:07 PM EST 2 months ago By Connor Smith Nvidia was on pace to close with a higher market cap than Amazon.com for the first time since 2002. Nvidia was up about 0.7% in Tuesday trading, which would bring its market cap to $1.8 trillion. Amazon, with a 1.8% decline, was down to $1.76 trillion. The last time Nvidia closed with a higher market cap than Amazon was on April 18, 2002, according to Dow Jones Market Data. Back then, Nvidia had a market cap of $5.73 billion compared to Amazon's $5.32 billion. They've both added a few more zeroes. Nvidia stock is up 1,748% in the past five years and about 234% in the past 12 months. Amazon stock is up 110% in the past five years and about 71% in the past year. NVIDIA Corp. NVDA (U.S.: Nasdaq) Amazon.com Inc. AMZN (U.S.: Nasdaq) Advertisement - Scroll to Continue
